original_text:
Product Selection Decision Tree and Quick Finder

Question 1: Do you need OIL LEVEL REGULATION or just LEVEL DETECTION?

If REGULATION (automatic oil return control):
‚Üí Go to TK Series (TK1+, TK3+, TK4)

If DETECTION only (level switch, ON/OFF signal):
‚Üí Go to LC Series (LC-PS, LC-PH, LC-XT, LC-XP) or K11/K25

TK Series Selection: TK1+ vs TK3+ vs TK4

Choose TK1+ if:
- Replacing mechanical sight glass on compressor crankcase
- Need compact footprint for tight spaces
- Application: Oil reservoir visual + electronic monitoring
- Budget: Most economical TK option

Choose TK3+ if:
- Need reliable oil level regulation with "install and forget" simplicity
- Budget-conscious vs TK4 (no need for NFC diagnostics)
- Single-unit or few installations (NFC benefit minimal)
- Standalone systems without BMS (TK3+ Base) OR centralized monitoring (TK3+ MB)

Choose TK4 if:
- Multiple units to configure (NFC saves commissioning time)
- Need advanced diagnostics and historical data logging
- Want smartphone-based parameter adjustment (no panel opening)
- Predictive maintenance strategy (TK4 MB with diagnostics)
- Higher initial cost justified by maintenance savings

LC Series Selection: LC-PS/XT vs LC-PH/XP

Choose LC-PS or LC-XT if:
- Operating pressure ‚â§46 bar
- Standard refrigeration (HFC, HFO: R134a, R404A, R410A)
- Simple level detection (not regulation)
- Cost-effective solution vs mechanical floats
- LC-XT variant: Prefer M12 connector for easier maintenance

Choose LC-PH or LC-XP if:
- Operating pressure >46 bar (up to 120 bar)
- CO2 transcritical systems (mandatory choice, 120 bar required)
- High-pressure NH3 applications
- Need reinforced construction for extreme conditions
- LC-XP variant: M12 connector for maintenance convenience

Specialized Sensor Selection

Choose K11 if:
- OEM equipment manufacturer (chillers, heat pumps)
- Need universal output compatibility (NPN/PNP/AC single model)
- Compact size is critical
- Want to simplify BOM and inventory
- Global supply chain (works with any PLC brand)

Choose K25 if:
- Need BOTH level AND temperature measurement
- Want to reduce installation time (50% vs 2 separate sensors)
- Single leak point preferred (safety/reliability)
- 4-20mA temperature output required
- Streamlined commissioning (one device to configure)

Choose ATEX-certified sensors if:
- MANDATORY: Using flammable refrigerants (R290, R600a, R1270, NH3)
- Installation in explosive atmosphere zones (Zone 1/2)
- Safety certification required by regulation or insurance
- Non-negotiable for legal compliance

Pressure Rating Summary:

46 bar models (Standard Refrigeration):
- TK1+, TK3+ Standard, TK4 Standard
- LC-PS, LC-XT
- K11, K25
- ATEX: LC-PS ATEX

60-90 bar models (Medium/High Pressure):
- TK3+ MP (60-80 bar)
- TK3+ HP (90 bar)
- TK4 HP (90 bar)

120-130 bar models (CO2 Transcritical):
- TK3+ CO2 (130 bar)
- TK4 CO2 (130 bar)
- LC-PH, LC-XP (120 bar)
- ATEX: LC-PH ATEX (120 bar)

Connectivity Options Summary:

Relay Output Only (Standalone):
- TK3+ Base, TK4 Base, TK1+
- All LC series
- K11, K25

MODBUS RTU RS485 (BMS/SCADA Integration):
- TK3+ MB
- TK4 MB

NFC Wireless Configuration (Smartphone App):
- TK4 Base
- TK4 MB

4-20mA Analog Output (Temperature):
- K25 only

messages.content:
You are an expert TECHNICAL SALES ASSISTANT for Teklab, a leading manufacturer of liquid level sensors and controllers for industrial applications.

üåç LANGUAGE ADAPTATION - ABSOLUTE PRIORITY:
**CRITICAL**: ALWAYS respond in the EXACT SAME LANGUAGE as the user's question.

LANGUAGE RULES (MANDATORY):
‚úÖ User writes in Italian ‚Üí You respond 100% in Italian
‚úÖ User writes in English ‚Üí You respond 100% in English  
‚úÖ User writes in Spanish ‚Üí You respond 100% in Spanish
‚úÖ User writes in German ‚Üí You respond 100% in German
‚úÖ NEVER mix languages in a single response

MISSION: Provide expert technical consultation on Teklab products, helping customers select the right sensor/controller for their specific application.

STYLE: Technical but accessible, consultative and solution-oriented, precise and data-driven.

PRODUCT CATEGORIES YOU SUPPORT:
- Oil Level Controllers (TK1+, TK3+, TK4 series)
- Liquid Level Sensors (LC-PS, LC-PH, LC-XP, LC-XT series)
- ATEX-certified sensors
- Specialized sensors (K11, K25)

Technical documentation context (Teklab Product Selection Guide):

[Selection Guide] - Complete decision tree for choosing the right Teklab product based on application requirements
Key Concepts: Regulation vs Detection, Pressure ratings (46, 90, 120-130 bar), Connectivity options (relay, MODBUS, NFC), ATEX mandatory for flammable refrigerants
üìå Important Details: First decide: regulation (TK series) or detection (LC series) | Pressure determines model: 46 bar standard, 120-130 bar for CO2 | ATEX is NON-NEGOTIABLE for R290/R600a/NH3 | K25 saves 50% installation time | TK4 adds NFC for multiple units

Complete technical text:
Product Selection Decision Tree

First Question: Do you need REGULATION or DETECTION?
- Regulation (automatic oil return) ‚Üí TK Series (TK1+, TK3+, TK4)
- Detection (level switch ON/OFF) ‚Üí LC Series or K11/K25

TK Series Selection:
- TK1+ ‚Üí Sight glass replacement, most economical
- TK3+ ‚Üí Reliable regulation, budget-friendly, "install and forget"
- TK4 ‚Üí TK3+ plus NFC configuration and advanced diagnostics

LC Series Selection:
- LC-PS/XT ‚Üí 46 bar, standard HFC/HFO refrigeration
- LC-PH/XP ‚Üí 120 bar, CO2 transcritical (mandatory)
- XT/XP variants ‚Üí M12 connector for easier maintenance

Specialized:
- K11 ‚Üí OEM compact, universal output, capacitive technology
- K25 ‚Üí Level + temperature in one unit, 50% time savings
- ATEX ‚Üí Mandatory for R290, R600a, NH3 in hazardous zones

Pressure Summary:
- 46 bar: TK1+, TK3+ Std, TK4 Std, LC-PS, LC-XT, K11, K25
- 90 bar: TK3+ HP, TK4 HP
- 120-130 bar: TK3+ CO2, TK4 CO2, LC-PH, LC-XP

Connectivity:
- Relay only: TK3+ Base, TK4 Base, TK1+, all LC, K11, K25
- MODBUS: TK3+ MB, TK4 MB
- NFC: TK4 Base, TK4 MB
- 4-20mA: K25 (temperature)

---

Question: How do I choose the right Teklab product?

Respond as an expert Teklab technical sales assistant with clear selection guidance.

Start by determining if you need oil level regulation (TK series) or just detection (LC series). Then consider pressure rating: 46 bar for standard systems, 120-130 bar for CO2 transcritical. For flammable refrigerants (R290, R600a, NH3), ATEX certification is mandatory.

metadata.chunk_title: Product Matrix - Selection Guide and Decision Tree
iconic_quotes: First decision: do you need regulation (TK series) or just detection (LC series)?
For CO2 transcritical, 120-130 bar rating is mandatory - use LC-PH/XP or TK3+/TK4 CO2
ATEX certification is non-negotiable for flammable refrigerants like R290, R600a, or NH3
TK4 adds NFC configuration - ideal for multiple units where commissioning speed matters
K25 replaces 2 sensors with 1, saving 50% installation time

qa_pairs.question: What's the first step in selecting a Teklab product?
qa_pairs.answer: First determine if you need oil level regulation (automatic oil return control) or just level detection (ON/OFF switch). Regulation requires TK series (TK1+, TK3+, TK4). Detection uses LC series (LC-PS, LC-PH, LC-XT, LC-XP) or specialized sensors (K11, K25).

qa_pairs.question: How do I know which pressure rating I need?
qa_pairs.answer: Check your system's maximum operating pressure: use 46 bar models for standard HFC/HFO refrigeration (‚â§46 bar), 90 bar models for high-pressure systems, and 120-130 bar models for CO2 transcritical applications. CO2 transcritical REQUIRES 120-130 bar rated sensors.

qa_pairs.question: When is ATEX certification required?
qa_pairs.answer: ATEX certification is mandatory and non-negotiable when using flammable refrigerants (R290/propane, R600a/isobutane, R1270, NH3/ammonia) or installing in explosive atmosphere zones (Zone 1 or Zone 2). It's required for regulatory compliance and insurance approval.

qa_pairs.question: Should I choose TK3+ MB or TK4 MB for BMS integration?
qa_pairs.answer: Both offer MODBUS RTU RS485 for BMS integration. Choose TK3+ MB for cost-effectiveness with proven technology. Choose TK4 MB if you also need NFC wireless configuration, advanced diagnostics with historical data logging, and smartphone-based parameter adjustment. TK4 MB is ideal for multiple units or predictive maintenance strategies.
